alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Guernsey; Harrison; Tuscarawas (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 11 at 4:38PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: .Moderate to heavy rainfall associated with the remnants of Nicole will continue to move through the region this evening. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Ohio, including the following counties, Carroll, Guernsey, Harrison and Tuscarawas. * WHEN...Until 830 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 436 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... New Philadelphia, Dover, Uhrichsville, Carrollton, Freeport, Dennison, Gnadenhutten, Antrim, Tuscarawas, Midvale, Port Washington, Bowerston, Barnhill, Dellroy, Sherrodsville, Roswell, Stone Creek, Leesville, Stillwater and Tippecanoe. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
